title: French Vintage Serif Font?
content:
Somebody who knows this font? Seems like a custom font but may be you guys know a similar font?  
Especially the A is what I am looking for…

Thanks for you help

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432im_/http:/typophile.com/files/140_4_5909.jpg)
author: romeotm

comments.content: Can't name it, most probably never digitized. I like [Baufuss](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/baumfuss) as alternative.
thanks, but Baufuss is too different!

An almost identical A -- with the angled cross stroke -- is found in F. W. Goudy's National Old Style and Nabisco fonts of 1916 and 1921.  
National:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GoudyHalfCentOfTypeV1p99NationalOSCharset_6105.jpg)
  
Nabisco:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GoudyHalfCentOfTypeV1p119Nabisco_5013.jpg)
  
National Old Style is available as a "prop font," i.e. an unedited autotrace from HPLHS [A Lovecraft fan and gaming group]  
 [http://www.cthulhulives.org/toybox/propdocs/propfonts.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432/http:/www.cthulhulives.org/toybox/propdocs/propfonts.html "http://www.cthulhulives.org/toybox/propdocs/propfonts.html")  
National is shown in detail at pages 300 to 305 of the ATF Catalog for 1923. Luc Devroye has an informative page  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-26299.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-26299.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-26299.html")  
The distinctive leg on the R is very similar to the one on Nicolas Jenson’s Roman. See  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/jenson/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/jenson/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/jenson/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/nicolas-jenson-sg/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/nicolas-jenson-sg/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/nicolas-jenson-sg/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/jenson-classico/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/jenson-classico/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/jenson-classico/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/jenson-classico/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404010432/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/jenson-classico/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/jenson-classico/")  
Don
Awesome! Thank you so much, that font looks great!

You're welcome Oliver. Many of F.W. Goudy's fonts have already been digitized. It's just a question of when, not if for this one. Interesting to see who gets there first.  
don
